constructors.doc:
Creates a status icon displaying the file filename.

The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.
constructors.name: new_from_file

constructors.doc: Creates a status icon displaying a Gio.Icon. If the icon is a themed icon, it will be updated when the theme changes.
constructors.name: new_from_gicon

constructors.doc: Creates a status icon displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.
constructors.name: new_from_icon_name

constructors.doc:
Creates a status icon displaying pixbuf.

The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.
constructors.name: new_from_pixbuf

constructors.doc: Creates a status icon displaying a stock icon. Sample stock icon names are #GTK_STOCK_OPEN, #GTK_STOCK_QUIT. You can register your own stock icon names, see and .
constructors.name: new_from_stock

doc:
The “system tray” or notification area is normally used for transient icons that indicate some special state. For example, a system tray icon might appear to tell the user that they have new mail, or have an incoming instant message, or something along those lines. The basic idea is that creating an icon in the notification area is less annoying than popping up a dialog.

A object can be used to display an icon in a “system tray”. The icon can have a tooltip, and the user can interact with it by activating it or popping up a context menu. Critical information should not solely be displayed in a , since it may not be visible (e.g. when the user doesn’t have a notification area on his panel). This can be checked with .

On X11, the implementation follows the FreeDesktop System Tray Specification. Implementations of the “tray” side of this specification can be found e.g. in the GNOME 2 and KDE panel applications.

Note that a GtkStatusIcon is not a widget, but just a GObject.Object. Making it a widget would be impractical, since the system tray on Win32 doesn’t allow to embed arbitrary widgets.

methods.doc:
Obtains information about the location of the status icon on screen. This information can be used to e.g. position popups like notification bubbles.

See for a more convenient alternative for positioning menus.

Note that some platforms do not allow GTK+ to provide this information, and even on platforms that do allow it, the information is not reliable unless the status icon is embedded in a notification area, see .
methods.name: get_geometry

methods.doc:
Retrieves the Gio.Icon being displayed by the . The storage type of the status icon must be .empty or .gicon (see ). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned Gio.Icon.

If this function fails, @icon is left unchanged;
methods.name: get_gicon

methods.doc: Returns the current value of the has-tooltip property. See for more information.
methods.name: get_has_tooltip

methods.doc: Gets the name of the icon being displayed by the . The storage type of the status icon must be .empty or .icon_name (see ). The returned string is owned by the and should not be freed or modified.
methods.name: get_icon_name

methods.doc: Gets the GdkPixbuf.Pixbuf being displayed by the . The storage type of the status icon must be .empty or .pixbuf (see ). The caller of this function does not own a reference to the returned pixbuf.
methods.name: get_pixbuf

methods.doc: Returns the Gdk.Screen associated with status_icon.
methods.name: get_screen

methods.doc:
Gets the size in pixels that is available for the image. Stock icons and named icons adapt their size automatically if the size of the notification area changes. For other storage types, the size-changed signal can be used to react to size changes.

Note that the returned size is only meaningful while the status icon is embedded (see ).
methods.name: get_size

methods.doc: Gets the id of the stock icon being displayed by the . The storage type of the status icon must be .empty or .stock (see ). The returned string is owned by the and should not be freed or modified.
methods.name: get_stock

methods.doc: Gets the type of representation being used by the to store image data. If the has no image data, the return value will be .empty.
methods.name: get_storage_type

methods.doc: Gets the title of this tray icon. See .
methods.name: get_title

methods.doc: Gets the contents of the tooltip for status_icon.
methods.name: get_tooltip_markup

methods.doc: Gets the contents of the tooltip for status_icon.
methods.name: get_tooltip_text

methods.doc: Returns whether the status icon is visible or not. Note that being visible does not guarantee that the user can actually see the icon, see also .
methods.name: get_visible

methods.doc:
This function is only useful on the X11/freedesktop.org platform. It returns a window ID for the widget in the underlying status icon implementation. This is useful for the Galago notification service, which can send a window ID in the protocol in order for the server to position notification windows pointing to a status icon reliably.

This function is not intended for other use cases which are more likely to be met by one of the non-X11 specific methods, such as .
methods.name: get_x11_window_id

methods.doc: Returns whether the status icon is embedded in a notification area.
methods.name: is_embedded

methods.doc: Makes status_icon display the file filename. See for details.
methods.name: set_from_file

methods.doc: Makes status_icon display the Gio.Icon. See for details.
methods.name: set_from_gicon

methods.doc: Makes status_icon display the icon named icon_name from the current icon theme. See for details.
methods.name: set_from_icon_name

methods.doc: Makes status_icon display pixbuf. See for details.
methods.name: set_from_pixbuf

methods.doc: Makes status_icon display the stock icon with the id stock_id. See for details.
methods.name: set_from_stock

methods.doc: Sets the has-tooltip property on status_icon to has_tooltip. See for more information.
methods.name: set_has_tooltip

methods.doc: Sets the name of this tray icon. This should be a string identifying this icon. It is may be used for sorting the icons in the tray and will not be shown to the user.
methods.name: set_name

methods.doc: Sets the Gdk.Screen where status_icon is displayed; if the icon is already mapped, it will be unmapped, and then remapped on the new screen.
methods.name: set_screen

methods.doc: Sets the title of this tray icon. This should be a short, human-readable, localized string describing the tray icon. It may be used by tools like screen readers to render the tray icon.
methods.name: set_title

methods.doc:
Sets markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat].

This function will take care of setting to true and of the default handler for the signal.

See also the property and .
methods.name: set_tooltip_markup

methods.doc:
Sets text as the contents of the tooltip.

This function will take care of setting to true and of the default handler for the signal.

See also the property and .
methods.name: set_tooltip_text

methods.doc: Shows or hides a status icon.
methods.name: set_visible

methods.doc: Menu positioning function to use with to position menu aligned to the status icon user_data.
methods.name: position_menu

name: StatusIcon

properties.doc: true if the statusicon is embedded in a notification area.
properties.name: embedded

properties.doc: The Gio.Icon displayed in the . For themed icons, the image will be updated automatically if the theme changes.
properties.name: gicon

properties.doc:
Enables or disables the emission of on @status_icon. A value of true indicates that @status_icon can have a tooltip, in this case the status icon will be queried using to determine whether it will provide a tooltip or not.

Note that setting this property to true for the first time will change the event masks of the windows of this status icon to include leave-notify and motion-notify events. This will not be undone when the property is set to false again.

Whether this property is respected is platform dependent. For plain text tooltips, use in preference.
properties.name: has-tooltip

properties.doc: The orientation of the tray in which the statusicon is embedded.
properties.name: orientation

properties.doc: The title of this tray icon. This should be a short, human-readable, localized string describing the tray icon. It may be used by tools like screen readers to render the tray icon.
properties.name: title

properties.doc:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string, which is marked up with the [Pango text markup language][PangoMarkupFormat]. Also see .

This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not null. will automatically be set to true and the default handler for the signal will take care of displaying the tooltip.

On some platforms, embedded markup will be ignored.
properties.name: tooltip-markup

properties.doc:
Sets the text of tooltip to be the given string.

Also see .

This is a convenience property which will take care of getting the tooltip shown if the given string is not null. will automatically be set to true and the default handler for the signal will take care of displaying the tooltip.

Note that some platforms have limitations on the length of tooltips that they allow on status icons, e.g. Windows only shows the first 64 characters.
properties.name: tooltip-text

signals.doc:
Gets emitted when the user activates the status icon. If and how status icons can activated is platform-dependent.

Unlike most G_SIGNAL_ACTION signals, this signal is meant to be used by applications and should be wrapped by language bindings.
signals.name: activate

signals.doc:
The ::button-press-event signal will be emitted when a button (typically from a mouse) is pressed.

Whether this event is emitted is platform-dependent. Use the ::activate and ::popup-menu signals in preference.
signals.name: button-press-event

signals.doc:
The ::button-release-event signal will be emitted when a button (typically from a mouse) is released.

Whether this event is emitted is platform-dependent. Use the ::activate and ::popup-menu signals in preference.
signals.name: button-release-event

signals.doc:
Gets emitted when the user brings up the context menu of the status icon. Whether status icons can have context menus and how these are activated is platform-dependent.

The button and activate_time parameters should be passed as the last to arguments to .

Unlike most G_SIGNAL_ACTION signals, this signal is meant to be used by applications and should be wrapped by language bindings.
signals.name: popup-menu

signals.doc:
Emitted when the hover timeout has expired with the cursor hovering above @status_icon; or emitted when @status_icon got focus in keyboard mode.

Using the given coordinates, the signal handler should determine whether a tooltip should be shown for @status_icon. If this is the case true should be returned, false otherwise. Note that if keyboard_mode is true, the values of x and y are undefined and should not be used.

The signal handler is free to manipulate tooltip with the therefore destined function calls.

Whether this signal is emitted is platform-dependent. For plain text tooltips, use in preference.
signals.name: query-tooltip

signals.doc:
The ::scroll-event signal is emitted when a button in the 4 to 7 range is pressed. Wheel mice are usually configured to generate button press events for buttons 4 and 5 when the wheel is turned.

Whether this event is emitted is platform-dependent.
signals.name: scroll-event

signals.doc: Gets emitted when the size available for the image changes, e.g. because the notification area got resized.
signals.name: size-changed
